result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Brian Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (7/17/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

Restitution to be determined in 60 days.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence immediately.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge - Def. sentenced

Defendant Patrick Brian Sheehan in court, in custody with attorney Teri M. Strohschein.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead, victim appears via phone, P.D.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Theft; Court reviews recomm.; Court finds plea made FV&I, finds Def. guilty of Theft/Repeater; victim makes statement; State heard; Atty. Strohschein heard; Def. does not make statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

** 1 year in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. immediately
- $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge
- Restitution to be determined in 60 days
-

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with P.G.D., w/f, dob 2/26/60 or her residence.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 203 Chatham Street, Beaver Dam, WI.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(3:53) Defendant Patrick Brian Sheehan in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (will appoint).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. State requests $5,000 cash and conditions; Atty. Vollan response, PO hold; RD 5/18/15 at 3:30 & JT 6/9/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $500 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with P.G.D., w/f, dob 2/26/60 or her residence.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
